page.title: 05FENTON-OLD AND NEW
page.content: Mrs Bagworth,one of our older villagers, told us about Fenton and how it had changed. The main attraction of Fenton is the pond. Women in the village used to knit socks for the geese on the local pond and walked them to Nottingham Goose Fair. The church used to be in the middle of the village but Oliver Cromwell burnt half of the village down. Therefore today the church is at the end 0f the village. Mr.Whittaker's house at the end of Pump Lane used to be a school and there used to be a train track running past Allen's farm. Today there is no school or train service in Fenton. Mrs Bagworth said there was a nunnery where Mr.Simon's swimming pool is opposite Pump Lane.
